intro: Condalia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile condalia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. It is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in landscaping.
